p: Although relative abundance of endophytic fungi in decaying roots increased across all studied microhabitats, we found a clear niche partitioning between P. fortinii s. l. and A. applanata, the two most well-known dark septate endophytes ( Grünig et al., 2008). While P. fortinii s. l. associated preferentially with decomposing spruce seedling roots in the ericoid shrub context, A. applanata was almost completely missing in this microhabitat while it dominated on decomposing spruce roots in other two microhabitats. A. applanata was previously almost exclusively isolated from P. abies roots, whereas P. fortinii s. l. showed preference for roots of ericoid plants, but occurred also on spruce roots ( Grünig et al., 2008). Therefore, ericoid plants may act as refuge for P. fortinii s. l. which may preferentially colonize roots spruce roots compare to A. applanata.
